thing-type.label: ZIF5029 Interface for Utility Meters (12-24V)
thing-type.description: Interface for Utility Meters (12-24V)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe ZIF5029 DIN-rail module is a device with a wireless Z-Wave communication protocol. It has 6 relay driven outputs and 6 pulse inputs (S0). The unit is a multi-purpose Z-Wave I/O module, which can be used for many applications. E.g. the module provides the possibility to control other systems via the Z-Wave network, by utilizing the 6 outputs as a kind of hand-over function to another automation system.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtUpon delivery, the ZIF5029 module has not been enrolled into any Z-Wave network. To communicate with other devices in the Z-Wave network, ZIF5029 must be enrolled in the network. This process is called to include the device in the Z-Wave network. Devices can also be removed from the Z-Wave network if they are to be used in another installation. This is called to exclude the device from the Z-Wave network.</p&gt <p&gtBoth processes are initiated by setting the central network controls in either inclusion or exclusion mode. Please refer to the network controller's manual how to set the central controls in either inclusion or exclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gtThe inclusion / exclusion mode on the ZIF5029 device is activated by pressing the small button through the hole in the front of the module, marked "INCLUSION", after which the status LED will start flashing.</p&gt <p&gtIf the device already belongs to a network, the device must be excluded before it can be included in the current network, otherwise the inclusion process will fail.</p&gt <p&gtFurthermore, see section 3 above about maintaining configuration parameters during exclusion / inclusion.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtSee inclusion section.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Status of LED
parameter.description: Status of LED<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter can be used to change the mode of the front-mounted status LED.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: The LED flashes in 1 second interval
The LED flashes in 1⁄2 second interval

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Brightness of status LED
parameter.description: Brightness of status LED<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDetermines the brightness of the status LED.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtSwitch off LED</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1-99</td&gt <td&gtBrightness level (%). (Standard 50%)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Output Function, Output 1
parameter.description: Output Function, Output 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtOutput is controlled via Z-Wave messages. (Standard)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gt(Not applicable)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Meter Type of input 1
parameter.description: Meter Type of input 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the type of meter connected to input 1.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Scale Type of input 1
parameter.description: Scale Type of input 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies unit type for the chosen meter type connected to input 1.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtChosen Meter Type</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtElectricity meter (1)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtkVAh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtW</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter (Standard)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt4</td&gt <td&gtV</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt5</td&gt <td&gtA</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt6</td&gt <td&gtPower Factor</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtGas meter (2)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtReserved</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtWater meter (3)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtUS gallons</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtHeat meter (4)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtCooling meter (5)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: Precision of input 1
parameter.description: Precision of input 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the number of decimals in the measurement format for entry 1. For example, if this field is set to 1, the value will be sent with 1 decimal (e.g. 102.5).</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0-7</td&gt <td&gtNumber of decimals. Standard is 0.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Pulses per Unit of input 1
parameter.description: Pulses per Unit of input 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the number of pulses to count before one unit is reached at input 1. For example, if this parameter is set to 1,000 and Scale Type is set to Cubic meters, 1,000 pulses is counted to equal 1m 3 .</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 – 65000</td&gt <td&gtNumber of pulses needed to equal one scale value. Standard is 1</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Rate Type of input 1
parameter.description: Rate Type of input 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies if the meter at input 1 register consumption or production. This is only used in Metering Reports sent on the Z-Wave network.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Meter Type of input 2
parameter.description: Meter Type of input 2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the type of meter connected to input 2.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Scale Type of input 2
parameter.description: Scale Type of input 2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies unit type for the chosen meter type connected to input 2.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtChosen Meter Type</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtElectricity meter (1)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtkVAh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtW</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter (Standard)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt4</td&gt <td&gtV</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt5</td&gt <td&gtA</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt6</td&gt <td&gtPower Factor</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtGas meter (2)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtReserved</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtWater meter (3)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtUS gallons</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtHeat meter (4)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtCooling meter (5)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: Precision of input 2.
parameter.description: Precision of input 2.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the number of decimals in the measurement format for input 2. For example, if this field is set to 1, the value will be sent with 1 decimal (e.g. 102.5).</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtValue</td&gt <td&gtDescription</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0-7</td&gt <td&gtNumber of decimals. For example, if this parameter is set to 1,000 and Scale Type is set to Cubic meters, 1,000 pulses is counted to equal 1m 3 .</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 – 65000</td&gt <td&gtNumber of pulses needed to equal one scale value. Standard is 1</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.description: Rate Type of input 2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies if the meter at input 2 register consumption or production. This is only used in Metering Reports sent on the Z-Wave network.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 20: Scale Type of input 3
parameter.description: Scale Type of input 3<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies unit type for the chosen meter type connected to input 3.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtChosen Meter Type</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtElectricity meter (1)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtkVAh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtW</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter (Standard)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt4</td&gt <td&gtV</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt5</td&gt <td&gtA</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt6</td&gt <td&gtPower Factor</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtGas meter (2)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtReserved</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtWater meter (3)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtUS gallons</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtHeat meter (4)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtCooling meter (5)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 21: Precision of input 3
parameter.description: Precision of input 3<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the number of decimals in the measurement format for input 3. For example, if this field is set to 1, the value will be sent with 1 decimal (e.g. 102.5).</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtValue</td&gt <td&gtDescription</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0-7</td&gt <td&gtNumber of decimals. parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: Scale Type of input 5
parameter.description: Scale Type of input 5<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies unit type for the chosen meter type connected to input 5.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtChosen Meter Type</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtElectricity meter (1)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtkVAh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtW</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter (Standard)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt4</td&gt <td&gtV</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt5</td&gt <td&gtA</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt6</td&gt <td&gtPower Factor</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtGas meter (2)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtReserved</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtWater meter (3)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtUS gallons</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtHeat meter (4)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtCooling meter (5)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh<br /&gt<br /&gt</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_31_1
parameter.label: 31: Precision of input 5
parameter.description: Precision of input 5<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the number of decimals in the measurement format for input 5. For example, if this field is set to 1, the value will be sent with 1 decimal (e.g. 102.5).</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0-7</td&gt <td&gtNumber of decimals. Standard is 0.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_32_2
parameter.label: 32: Pulses per Unit of input 5
parameter.description: Pulses per Unit of input 5<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the number of pulses to count before one unit is reached at input 5. For example, if this parameter is set to 1,000 and Scale Type is set to Cubic meters, 1,000 pulses is counted to equal 1m 3 .</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0-65000</td&gt <td&gtNumber of pulses needed to equal one scale value. Standard is 1</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_33_1
parameter.label: 33: Rate Type of input 5.
parameter.description: Rate Type of input 5.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies if the meter at input 5 register consumption or production. This is only used in Metering Reports sent on the Z-Wave network.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_34_1
parameter.label: 34: Meter Type of input 6
parameter.description: Meter Type of input 6<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the type of meter connected to input 6.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_35_1
parameter.label: 35: Scale Type of input 6
parameter.description: Scale Type of input 6<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies unit type for the chosen meter type connected to input 6.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtChosen Meter Type</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtElectricity meter (1)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtkVAh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtW</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter (Standard)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt4</td&gt <td&gtV</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt5</td&gt <td&gtA</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt6</td&gt <td&gtPower Factor</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtGas meter (2)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtReserved</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtWater meter (3)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtCubic meter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtCubic foot</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtUS gallons</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt </td&gt <td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtPulse counter</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtHeat meter (4)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtCooling meter (5)</td&gt <td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtkWh<br /&gt<br /&gt</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_36_1
parameter.label: 36: Precision of input 6
parameter.description: Precision of input 6<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the number of decimals in the measurement format for input 6. For example, if this field is set to 1, the value will be sent with 1 decimal (e.g. 102.5).</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0-7</td&gt <td&gtNumber of decimals. Standard is 0</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_37_2
parameter.label: 37: Pulses per Unit of input 6
parameter.description: Pulses per Unit of input 6<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the number of pulses to count before one unit is reached at input 6. For example, if this parameter is set to 1,000 and Scale Type is set to Cubic meters, 1,000 pulses is counted to equal 1m 3 .</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0-65000</td&gt <td&gtNumber of pulses needed to equal one scale value. Standard is 1</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_38_1
parameter.label: 38: Rate Type of input 6
parameter.description: Rate Type of input 6<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies if the meter at input 6 register consumption or production. This is only used in Metering Reports sent on the Z-Wave network.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter is retained during exclusion / inclusion of the device.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_39_2
parameter.label: 39: Time interval between meter reports
parameter.description: Time interval between meter reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSpecifies the time interval between the automatic Meter Reports for each input.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt<strong&gtValue</strong&gt</td&gt <td&gt<strong&gtDescription</strong&gt</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 – 8640</td&gt <td&gt0 – 864 seconds. Standard value is 90 (equal to 900 seconds) which will send a report every 15 minute.</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Lifeline group for the entire module.
